pages.text: Thaumaptilon is a sessile Cambrian animal from the Burgess Shale which looks similar to the Ediacaran frondose like organisms. It was leaf shaped and it had a central stalk with many ribs extending from it. Thaumaptilon comes from the Greek thauma 'wonder' and ptilon 'feather.'
